intro: Rehmannia chinensis, commonly known as Chinese foxglove, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are opposite in arrangement. Its flowers, which range in color from purple to pink, bloom in late spring to early summer. Rehmannia chinensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional medicinal uses in Chinese medicine.
